column4: good day, I just installed ubuntu for the first time and was wondering how I might adjust my refresh rate, presently it only permits 60 as an option, I would like 85
I am not at the last part where I am to choose the type of linux-restricted-modules, I am running an AMD x2 4400+, which should I choose?
what is the difference between k8 and k8-smp?
i don't seem to have any other options, I am still resting with 60Hz as the only refresh available
what does "glxinfo | grep direct" say (in a terminal)
good. check if your hsync and vsync are correct in /etc/X11/xorg.conf (in terminal: "sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf)
I think this is the problem
I guess when I installed the OS I went with generic and thus it just set generic ? not sure, I was only provided with the option of going what res, not what refresh
you see the section "screen" in the file?
thanks a lot for your help, I accidently edited the a line and then didn't edit the refernece to it in screen, but I was able to fix it all up, and now things work very well, my eyes thank you
